plugins.name: Batch Hide
plugins.description:
Hide all the stuff you want (or don't want) with one click: useful to hide notes, sketches, versions and anything you can think of. Right click or access it in the sidebar.

  1. Add the layers you want to hide.
  2. Toggle visibility to show or hide.
  3. All the layers you marker will hide/show.


Let me know what you think in the comments <3

plugins.name: Protoboi
plugins.description:
From the makers of 'Prototype This!'... comes Protoboi.


Protoboi is a tool to save you time prototyping. It helps you perfect your interactions (bezier easing curves, durations etc.) quickly by treating them in a componentized way.


Here's how the workflow works-


1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
plugins.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

plugins.name: Quick Layout Calculator
plugins.description: Constantly reveal spacing between elements in your designs with clear, red labels showing exact pixel measurements. Perfect for design system maintainers and UI developers who need quick spacing verification without manual guides. Select a frame, click "Show Spacing" to display distances, and "Hide Spacing" to remove them. Works with all layer types and keeps your design clean by focusing on nearby elements.
plugins.tagline: Quick Layout Calculator: Instantly reveal spacing between elements with clear, pixelmeasurements.

plugins.description:
👩🏻‍🎨 Colour Tools makes it easier for web and mobile software developers to work with colours:

  1. Pick colours and create colour palettes, either using the plugin's colour picker, or from existing colours in your project
  2. Generate shades from any colour, choosing one ad-hoc or from existing styles in your project
  3. Copy code snippets for software development on web and Android, making it easier for you to add colours to CSS (including preprocessors), Android (including XML and Jetpack Compose)

More information here.

plugins.name: Real Content Filler
plugins.description:
Real Data Filler is a quick and smart plugin that populates your Figma text layers with realistic placeholder data — perfect for mockups, UI design, and prototypes.


Choose from a clean, tabbed interface with options like:


Names (full names, first/last)


Emails (realistic domains)


Cities (worldwide)


Phone Numbers


Custom Lists (coming soon)


Each selected text node gets a random data value of the type you select.


Use this to:


Populate wireframes with real-seeming names and emails


Fill mobile/table UI designs with user data


Quickly visualize form states and list views

plugins.name: Text Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin User Guide for Beginners


What It Does

This Figma plugin lets you update text and hide layers in selected frames or instances. It’s easy to use with a text-based configuration for both specific and global changes.


How to Use It

  1. Select a Frame or Instance: In Figma, click a frame or instance to edit.
  2. Open the Plugin: Run the plugin from Figma’s menu (Plugins > Your Plugin Name).
  3. Enter Configuration: In the plugin window, type instructions to change text or hide layers (see examples below).
  4. Click Run: The plugin applies your changes instantly.


Configuration Examples

• Change Specific Text: To update text in a layer named title inside a frame named block, type:

block.title: Hello World

This sets the title layer’s text to "Hello World".


• Change Text Globally: To update all layers named text in any frame, type:

text: Welcome

This changes every text layer’s text to "Welcome".


• Hide a Specific Layer: To hide a layer named subtitle in the block frame, type:

//block.subtitle

This hides the subtitle layer.


• Hide a Layer Globally: To hide all layers named icon, type:

//icon

This hides every icon layer.


• Rename a Frame: To rename a frame named block, type:

$Title block: New Frame Name

This renames the frame to "New Frame Name".


• Combine Actions: Mix specific and global changes, like:

block.title: Welcome
text: Hello
//block.subtitle
//icon

This updates block.title to "Welcome", all text layers to "Hello", hides block.subtitle, and hides all icon layers.


Tips

  1. Write one instruction per line.
  2. Layer names must match exactly (case-sensitive).
  3. Select at least one frame or instance, or you’ll get an error.
plugins.tagline: Automatically update text in frames with key-value data

135574.name: Text Auto Fill
135574.description:

• Change Text Globally: To update all layers named text in any frame, type:

• Hide a Specific Layer: To hide a layer named subtitle in the block frame, type:

This hides the subtitle layer.

• Rename a Frame: To rename a frame named block, type:

This renames the frame to "New Frame Name".


• Combine Actions: Mix specific and global changes, like:

text: Hello

This updates block.title to "Welcome", all text layers to "Hello", hides block.subtitle, and hides all icon layers.


Tips

plugins.name: Prism by lumos
plugins.description:
🌈 Prism by Lumos


A smarter way to manage your Figma color variables


Prism is a powerful, easy-to-use plugin built to help you create, organize, and maintain a clean, scalable color system in Figma. Whether you’re building from scratch or refining an existing system, Prism takes the heavy lifting out of color management.


It’s the same powerful tool we use to power the Lumos Design System — with token-based color management built right in.


⸻


✨ What Prism does best

•🎨 Full Color System

Instantly generate a complete color palette (from 50 to 900) based on your base colors.

•🔗 Semantic Color Mapping

Create semantic color variables that stay linked to your base palette.

•🌗 Light & Dark Theme Support

Effortlessly manage color values for both light and dark modes.

•🧰 Visual Color Editor

Tweak colors visually with a real-time preview — no guesswork required.

•📁 Clean, Organized Structure

Keeps your color variables tidy and consistent with logical naming and folders.

•🧩 Built for Design Tokens

Prism follows a token-based approach inspired by the Lumos Design System, making it easy to plug into any design system workflow.


⸻


Prism helps you focus on what matters — great design — by handling the complexity of color systems behind the scenes. Perfect for design systems, large projects, or anyone who wants a more organized Figma file.
plugins.tagline: Color token management designed to power the Lumos Design System.

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

plugins.name: Frames by Names
plugins.description:
Frames by Names is your new Figma sidekick!


Tired of manually creating and naming frames one by one? Just paste in your list of names, pick your desired frame size and letter case style (or keep it original), and watch as your canvas magically fills with neatly organized frames right where you're looking.


Whether you're brainstorming, organizing, or just having fun with names, this plugin makes design setup quick and playful. Say hello to effortless layouts and goodbye to tedious frame creation—let Frames by Names bring order (and a dash of whimsy) to your Figma workflow!

plugins.name: Asset Dependencies
plugins.description:
Effortlessly manage and visualize your Figma assets with the Asset Dependencies plugin. This powerful tool scans and analyzes your local Figma files, creating a topologically sorted list of all components, subcomponents, dependencies, and usage.


Comprehensive analysis

Automatically scans your Figma assets to identify all components and their relationships.


Topological sorting

Generates a clear, topologically sorted list of components and subcomponents, making it easy to understand dependencies.


Dependency mapping

Visualize which components are used by others, helping you manage and optimize your design system.


Usage insights

See at a glance how and where each component is used across your file.


Export options

Export lists as CSV files to use in other tools.

plugins.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
plugins.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.


Implementation Plan:


Creating the Interface:


Add a button labeled "Create Rectangle."

Prepare a canvas or container where the rectangle will appear.

Styling Elements:


Define styles for the button (e.g., color, shape).

Set default dimensions and properties for the rectangle (e.g., width, height, background color).

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.
plugins.tagline: Rectangle

110619.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
110619.description:

Why pay lots of money for other tools when you can just Fig2Ad.

Create animated HTML banners directly from Figma prototypes.


How it works

  1. Design frames in Figma and setup transitions using Smart Animate
  2. Generate HTML with 1-click with the Fig2Ad plugin
  3. Use the HTML banner wherever you want


Why pay lots of money for other tools when you can just Fig2Ad.


Example: https://www.figma.com/community/file/1463635947860608501/fig2ad-playground
116119.tagline: Create animated HTML banners directly from Figma prototypes

plugins.description: 此插件旨在帮助设计师和开发者快速高效地将 Figma 中的设计内容无缝迁移到我们的内部系统 CDS（Content Delivery System）。通过简单易用的操作界面，您可以轻松导出设计文件、组件和图层，并确保所有数据在 CDS 中正确存储和管理，从而提高工作流程的效率，减少重复劳动。适用于需要在多平台间协同工作的团队，助力项目的快速迭代和交付。

plugins.name: CSV to Table
plugins.description:
Convierte fácilmente archivos CSV en tablas dentro de Figma.


Con el plugin CSV to Table, importar datos a tus diseños nunca fue tan fácil. Simplemente selecciona tu archivo .csv y el plugin generará una tabla visual editable directamente en tu lienzo de Figma. Ideal para diseñadores de productos, equipos de UX/UI y presentaciones con datos reales.


🔹 Importa datos reales sin salir de Figma

🔹 Transforma automáticamente filas y columnas en capas de texto y formas

🔹 Personaliza estilos una vez importado

🔹 Sin necesidad de conexión a internet – tus datos permanecen seguros


Este recurso es completamente gratuito y no almacena tu información. Solo tú tienes acceso a los datos que importas.


---


Easily turn CSV files into tables inside Figma.


With the CSV to Table plugin, importing structured data into your designs is effortless. Just upload your .csv file, and this plugin will generate an editable table directly on your Figma canvas. Perfect for product designers, UX/UI teams, or anyone working with real data.


🔹 Import real data without leaving Figma

🔹 Automatically transforms rows and columns into styled text and shapes

🔹 Customize your table’s style after import

🔹 No internet connection needed – your data stays safe


This is a completely free community resource. Your data is never uploaded or stored externally.
plugins.tagline: Convierte CSV en tablas editables / Convert CSV files into editable Figma tables instantly.

plugins.name: BlendAI
plugins.description:
BlendAI seamlessly integrates with Figma to let you generate high-quality images from text prompts or combine up to three reference images in a single click. It’s perfect for product mockups, hero banners, packshots, concept art, backgrounds, or quick visual inspiration—without ever leaving your Figma file.


Key Features:

• Simple prompt → image

Type a natural-language description and instantly receive a crisp, AI-rendered result.

• Multi-reference blending

Upload up to three reference images (for example: a product shot, a texture, and a background) and instruct BlendAI to place, style, or combine them.

Example: “Place @IMG_1 in front of @IMG_2 with the lighting mood of @IMG_3.”

• Six aspect-ratio presets

1:1 (Square), 16:9 (Landscape), 9:16 (Portrait), 4:3 (Classic), 3:4 (Portrait), 21:9 (Ultrawide)

• Instant one-click generation

No manual exports or workarounds—everything happens directly in Figma’s interface.

• Credit-based system

Includes a free 10-image starter pack. Easily top up credits from the “Get More” menu.

• History & quick re-use

View, revisit, and re-generate past images directly within the plugin.


BlendAI was built for designers who need on-the-fly visuals—whether it’s a quick hero image for a mockup, a polished packshot for a product page, or a fully blended scene combining multiple photo references. Try it free, then unlock larger credit packs for heavy usage.
plugins.tagline: AI image generation & multi-reference blending inside Figma for hero banners, mockups or backgrounds

136150.name: BlendAI
136150.description:

It’s perfect for product mockups, hero banners, packshots, concept art, backgrounds, or quick visual inspiration—without ever leaving your Figma file.


Key Features:

Type a natural-language description and instantly receive a crisp, AI-rendered result.

• Multi-reference blending

Example: “Place @IMG_1 in front of @IMG_2 with the lighting mood of @IMG_3.”

• Six aspect-ratio presets

1:1 (Square), 16:9 (Landscape), 9:16 (Portrait), 4:3 (Classic), 3:4 (Portrait), 21:9 (Ultrawide)

• Instant one-click generation

No manual exports or workarounds—everything happens directly in Figma’s interface.

• Credit-based system

Includes a free 10-image starter pack. Easily top up credits from the “Get More” menu.

• History & quick re-use

View, revisit, and re-generate past images directly within the plugin.


BlendAI was built for designers who need on-the-fly visuals—whether it’s a quick hero image for a mockup, a polished packshot for a product page, or a fully blended scene combining multiple photo references. Try it free, then unlock larger credit packs for heavy usage.

plugins.name: Scout : Your Design System Auditor
plugins.description:
Scout: Your Design System Auditor

Ever felt like your design tokens are playing hide-and-seek? 🕵️‍♀️ Meet Scout, your trusty design detective—ready to sniff out sneaky inconsistencies and bring harmony back to your Figma universe!


Scout swiftly audits your Figma files, uncovering rogue color hexes and typography rebels that forgot their tokens at home. No more developer handoff blues or "Oops, missed that!" moments. 🎯


Superpowers:

Color Detective: Catches color chaos quicker than you can shout “Hex!”


Typography Sleuth: Spots font fugitives and sizes that went astray, keeping your design tight.


Smart Suggestions: Suggests spot-on tokens and handy fallbacks instantly—because who doesn't love instant magic? ✨


Theme-Agnostic: Works seamlessly with both light and dark themes, maintaining style consistency across all modes.


Local Variable & Style Support: Perfectly compatible with local variables and styles, ensuring complete design system integration.


Pinpoint Precision: Clearly tells you exactly where the issue is—no guessing games, just solutions!


How to Use Scout:


1. Feed Your Tokens: Connect Scout to your design system first—it'll securely save all your tokens locally.

2. Scan: Open Scout in any Figma file, select the frame you want to check, and hit "Scan."

3. Instant Results: Scout immediately highlights issues, suggests precise fixes, and ensures your designs stay token-perfect.


Scout is fun, quirky, and deadly accurate; a designer's best friend and a developer's dream come true. Let Scout do the heavy lifting and keep your designs perfectly polished. 


Get Scout today and give your design system the auditor it deserves.


Scout is currently in beta. Found bugs? Have questions, suggestions, or feature requests? 💌 DM me on Twitter

accepted.name: Satyam
accepted.description: Product and UI/UX Designer | Email me at sat02yam@gmail.com

plugins.tagline: Keep Scouting

plugins.name: Fieldnotes
plugins.description:
Fieldnotes transforms in-person workshop sticky notes into digital boards.


Simply take photos of your sticky notes using your phone (you just have to scan a QR code to sync) or upload images directly to the plugin. Your physical sticky notes are instantly recreated in your board, preserving the texts, colors, position, and all your ideas :)


Fieldnotes combines several AI recognition technologies to boost accuracy and to detect even messy handwriting across multiple languages.

Pro users gain access to powerful AI-enhanced features including text improvement, grammar correction, and automatic workshop summaries.


Transform raw workshop notes into polished, actionable content and generate comprehensive takeaways to share with stakeholders, a dream follow-up!


If you want to learn more about the plugin or simply because you are passionate about Product or collaboration, feel free to reach out
plugins.tagline: Fieldnotes transforms pictures of sticky notes into stickies — ready to share, without the hassle

Explore global airports by continent, country, and city — then instantly write localized airport details into your selected Figma text layers!

plugins.name: RTL智能适配助手 RTL Auto Adapt Helper
plugins.description:
介绍

本插件可帮助设计师一键启用或关闭组件的“阿语”属性，用于快速适配阿拉伯语等 RTL（从右至左）语言界面。支持自动识别并批量设置所选节点及其子组件的变量值，提高国际化效率。


功能说明

  1. 自动查找所选组件中的“阿语”变量属性
  2. 一键切换阿语属性值为 on 或 off
  3. 实时统计处理成功和失败的组件数量
  4. 支持递归处理嵌套结构与实例组件


使用方法

  1. 在 Figma 中选中一个或多个组件或画板
  2. 打开插件界面
  3. 点击“启用阿语模式”或“关闭阿语模式”按钮
  4. 查看统计信息，确认处理结果


注意事项

  1. 插件仅处理存在“阿语”变量属性的组件
  2. 若组件未设置该属性，将不会被修改
  3. 暂不支持自动创建属性，请先在组件中配置好“阿语”变量


Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click “Enable Arabic Mode” or “Disable Arabic Mode”
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties — please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Smart Arabic mode toggle for RTL-friendly components

136438.description:

  3. 暂不支持自动创建属性，请先在组件中配置好“阿语”变量


Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click “Enable Arabic Mode” or “Disable Arabic Mode”
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  2. The plugin does not create new properties — please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

plugins.name: Find & Replace Anything
plugins.description:
Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!


A powerful tool for finding and replacing styles! Works with components, instances and library styles. Especially helpful to align parameters across projects in bulk like auto layout or library styles for your pixel perfect design.


Plugin is in active development. Therefore, any feedback is appreciated! Like our plugin? Leave a heart!


Full feature list:


Library & local Styles

  1. Fonts
  2. Colors
  3. Effects
  4. Grids


Variables (search only)

  1. Color Variable
  2. Number Variable
  3. String Variable
  4. Boolean Variable


Shape & Frame

  1. Name
  2. Width
  3. Height
  4. Position X
  5. Position Y
  6. Rotation
  7. Constrain Proportions
  8. Clip content


Text

  1. Text
  2. Font Size
  3. Paragraphs Spacing
  4. Paragraph Indent
  5. Text Decoration
  6. Text Case
  7. Text Resizing
  8. Text Align Horizontal
  9. Text Align Vertical


Layer

  1. Blend Mode
  2. Opacity
  3. Visibility


Stroke

  1. Stroke Align
  2. Stroke Weight
  3. Stroke Join


Auto Layout

  1. Layout mode
  2. Spacing between items
  3. Paddings

plugins.name: Move Outside
plugins.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:


  1. Default - Moves selected single or multiple elements to the top of the page’s layer hierarchy.
  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.
plugins.tagline: A plugin used to move elements to the top of the layer hierarchy or to other frames/sections.

106901.name: Move Outside
106901.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:


  1. Default - Moves selected single or multiple elements to the top of the page’s layer hierarchy.
  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.
106901.tagline: A plugin used to move elements to the top of the layer hierarchy or to other frames/sections.

plugins.name: Lint copy
plugins.description:
Lint copy helps UX writers and content designers automatically enforce style rules with a custom word list.


Enforce things like plain language (e.g. detect "utilize" and suggest replacing it with "use"), the company's voice and tone (e.g. detect "we are" and suggest using the contraction), and even product terminology.


Create a custom word list in JSON and host it in a public GitHub repository to experience the plugin's full power.


The plugin also enforces sentence case and strings starting with a capital, neither of which is customizable.


For full details, read the documentation.
plugins.tagline: Check text layers against a word list to enforce style, voice, and terminology.

103128.name: Lint copy
103128.description:
Lint copy helps UX writers and content designers automatically enforce style rules with a custom word list.


Enforce things like plain language (e.g. detect "utilize" and suggest replacing it with "use"), the company's voice and tone (e.g. detect "we are" and suggest using the contraction), and even product terminology.


Create a custom word list in JSON and host it in a public GitHub repository to experience the plugin's full power.


The plugin also enforces sentence case and strings starting with a capital, neither of which is customizable.


For full details, read the documentation.
103128.tagline: Check text layers against a word list to enforce style, voice, and terminology.

“디자인은 잠시 접어두고, 일본어 타이핑 연습으로 머리 좀 식혀보세요. 어때요, 기분 전환 좀 될까요?”

“Put the design aside for a moment and cool off with some Japanese typing practice. How about a little change of pace?”

plugins.name: Pixabay Illustrations
plugins.description:
Pixabay Illustrations Library is a powerful Figma plugin that brings you an extensive collection of high-quality illustrations directly from Pixabay. With thousands of unique designs at your fingertips, you can easily enhance your projects and inspire creativity. Whether you're working on web designs, presentations, or marketing materials, our library offers diverse styles to suit any theme.


Key Features:


Vast Collection: Access thousands of free illustrations in various styles and categories.

Easy Integration: Seamlessly add illustrations to your designs without leaving Figma.

Search Functionality: Quickly find the perfect illustration using keywords or categories.

High-Quality Graphics: All images are royalty-free and suitable for commercial use.

Transform your design workflow with the Pixabay Illustrations Library and watch your creativity soar!

accepted.name: sadik sajid
accepted.description: Hi, I'm sadik sajid — a passionate designer crafting intuitive and visually engaging digital experiences. I specialize in user interfaces, design systems

plugins.tagline: Elevate Your Designs with Stunning Illustrations
